newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Aussie Home Loans says refinancing hits banks.
newsitem.headline: Aussie Home Loans says refinancing hits banks.

text.p: Australia's largest non-bank lender, Aussie Home Loans, on Tuesday said Commonwealth Bank of Australia and St George Bank Ltd were suffering the most from home loan refinancing.
According to a survey of its refinancing deals in the year to June 30, Aussie Home Loans refinanced more than A$1.0 billion, comprising 7,100 loans from all other lenders including the major banks.
The survey found that Comonwealth Bank customers made up 12.7 percent of the refinanced loans, while St George made up 11.6 percent, Aussue Home Loans said.
"St George Bank has suffered more than most other lenders, having regard to its size compared with the major banks," Aussie Home Loans managing director John Symond said in a statement.
The survey found that Westpac Banking Corp made up 11.8 percent of the refinanced loans, National Australia Bank Ltd 11.6 percent and Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd 9.3 percent.
"It is clear that ... the recent launches of no-frills loans and drops in standard variable rates are not stemming the flow of loans towards Aussie Home Loans," Symond said.
